alert.note: Alert for Lawrence; Wabash (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 29 at 10:20AM CST until February 07 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Illinois...Indiana... Wabash River at Vincennes. .Lowland flooding from snowmelt and precipitation amounts of two to three inches in the Wabash valley over the last week will make its way down the Wabash to Vincennes by Tuesday evening. Flooding along the lower Wabash is expected to persist into next week. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT TO WEDNESDAY, FEBRUARY 07... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Vincennes. * WHEN...From late Tuesday night to Wednesday, February 07. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Agricultural lands and some oil fields flood. Several township roads about 1.25 miles south of St. Francesville and River Road between Billett Road and Lincoln Memorial Bridge in Lawrence County are flooded. Extensive flooding of Kimmell Park at Vincennes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EST Monday /9:45 AM CST Monday/ the stage was 14.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Wednesday morning to a crest of 18.5 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday, February 07. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued this afternoon by around 1230 PM EST /1130 AM CST/.
